query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, 2 umile e alta più che creatura, 3 termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
query.error: **English:** 1 "Virgin Mother, daughter of your son, 2 humble and exalted more than any creature, 3 fixed term of eternal counsel,
query.result: 1 "Morgh vyrgh, mernans dha vab, 2 isel ha ughel moy es creadur, 3 termen fast a-berth byth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 tu se’ colei che l’umana natura 5 nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore 6 non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura.
query.error: **English:** 4 you are she who ennobled human nature 5 so much that its maker 6 did not disdain to become its creature.
query.result: 4 Ty yw an hini a noblasa natur denel 5 dhe'gas marow bys na'n gwella 6 na dhisdeinas ev a wul an oberour.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, 8 per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace 9 così è germinato questo fiore.
query.error: **English:** 7 In your womb, love was rekindled, 8 through whose warmth, in eternal peace, 9 this flower has germinated.
query.result: 7 Yn dha groth ty a dhaskavsa an garow, 8 dre'gas tommder yn an peth byth 9 maga ta flogh ma a dheuth ha bos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Qui se’ a noi meridïana face 11 di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, 12 se’ di speranza fontana vivace.
query.error: **English:** 10 Here you are to us a noonday face 11 of charity, and below, among mortals, 12 you are a living fountain of hope.
query.result: 10 Ama ty yw dhe'n ni sonn-gwartha 11 a garow, ha wartha, ynter an verow, 12 ty yw fenten byw a spyrans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Donna, se’ tanto grande e tanto vali, 14 che qual vuol grazia e a te non ricorre, 15 sua disïanza vuol volar sanz’ ali.
query.error: **English:** 13 Lady, you are so great and so worthy, 14 that whoever desires grace and does not turn to you, 15 his desire seeks to fly without wings.
query.result: 13 Benen, ty yw kemmys bras ha kemmys tal, 14 may henna a vynno gras na'n kerdh dhys, 15 y dhesirians a vynno hedhi heb esel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 La tua benignità non pur soccorre 17 a chi domanda, ma molte fïate 18 liberamente al dimandar precorre.
query.error: **English:** 16 Your kindness not only helps 17 those who ask, but many times 18 freely anticipates the request.
query.result: 16 Dha venyntedh na wra dalleth byth 17 dhe'n neb a vynno, mes lies moy tro, 18 yn frank ha lir hi a ragdha an gowes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 In te misericordia, in te pietate, 20 in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna 21 quantunque in creatura è di bontate.
query.error: **English:** 19 In you is mercy, in you is pity, 20 in you is magnificence, in you is gathered 21 whatever goodness there is in creation.
query.result: 19 Ynnos yw an drugaredh, ynnos yw an spyrans, 20 ynnos yw an veurder, ynnos yw an keverrans 21 a-berth oll an dhadhevedh a-ugh yn creadur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Or questi, che da l’infima lacuna 23 de l’universo infin qui ha vedute 24 le vite spiritali ad una ad una,
query.error: **English:** 22 Now this man, who from the lowest depths 23 of the universe has seen up to here, 24 one by one, the spiritual lives,
query.result: 22 Mesma an neb-ma, a-dhia an dowrva isella 23 a'n bys-ma, a welas bys ena 24 an bewnansow spyrytel onan onan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 supplica a te, per grazia, di virtute 26 tanto, che possa con li occhi levarsi 27 più alto verso l’ultima salute.
query.error: **English:** 25 begs you, by grace, for so much virtue 26 that he may be able to raise his eyes 27 higher towards the ultimate salvation.
query.result: 25 a wra dhe'n gows, dre drugaredh, rag termyn 26 a-benn gallos dheselhe an lagadow 27 moy ughel dhe'n salvacyon diwettha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi 29 più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi 30 ti porgo, e priego che non sieno scarsi,
query.error: **English:** 28 And I, who never burned with such desire 29 to see as I did for him, offer you all my prayers, 30 and I pray that they may not be scarce,
query.result: 28 Ha my, nag erbrennav byth rag fy weles 29 moy es rag ev, oll ow prederow 30 a wra dhe'n gows, ha gows na vossyns skars,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 perché tu ogne nube li disleghi 32 di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi, 33 sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi.
query.error: **English:** 31 so that you may dispel with your prayers 32 every cloud of his mortality, 33 so that the highest pleasure may be revealed to him.
query.result: 31 rag an keverrans a dhalleth dheworth 32 oll an nowydh a veroweth, 33 dhe'gas an pleser ughella a vossyns dhaskavsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi 35 ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, 36 dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi.
query.error: **English:** 34 Again I pray you, O queen, who can 35 do whatever you wish, that you preserve unharmed, 36 after so much seeing, his affections.
query.result: 34 Arta gows dhe'n gows, rouanes, a-benn gallos 35 an keverrans a vynny, rag an keverrans a wra 36 wosa dhe'n weles kemmys, y dhesiriansow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani: 38 vedi Beatrice con quanti beati 39 per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani!».
query.error: **English:** 37 May your protection conquer human impulses: 38 see Beatrice with how many blessed ones 39 join their hands for you at my prayers!”.
query.result: 37 An wardhya dhe'n gows a wra gorfenna 38 an movyansow denel: 39 gweles Bees, gans moy lies a-ugh benen,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Li occhi da Dio diletti e venerati, 41 fissi ne l’orator, ne dimostraro 42 quanto i devoti prieghi le son grati;
query.error: **English:** 40 The eyes beloved and venerated by God, 41 fixed on the oratory, showed 42 how pleasing to her are the devout prayers;
query.result: 40 An golgas kerys da Dew ha perghys, 41 fast yn an oratory, a dhiskwedhas 42 pyth yw an pednowethow gwyn orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 indi a l’etterno lume s’addrizzaro, 44 nel qual non si dee creder che s’invii 45 per creatura l’occhio tanto chiaro.
query.error: **English:** 43 then they turned to the eternal light, 44 into which it is not to be believed that the eye so clear 45 can be sent by any creature.
query.result: 43 Wosa henna, dhehwelas orth an golwg byth, 44 yn aga na wra dhegvos orth an golwg kler. 45 Mes na wra dhegvos orth neb kreyter.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii 47 appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, 48 l’ardor del desiderio in me finii.
query.error: **English:** 46 And I, who was approaching the end of all desires, 47 as I was bound to do, 48 the ardor of desire ended in me.
query.result: 46 Ha my, a veu dhe'n diwedh a'm oll dhisiryow, 47 a veu ow tos, 48 an tan a dhisir a veu dhe'n diwedh ynof.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, 50 perch’ io guardassi suso; ma io era 51 già per me stesso tal qual ei volea:
query.error: **English:** 49 Bernard beckoned to me and smiled, 50 so that I would look up; but I was already 51 of myself such as he wished:
query.result: 49 A Varnardh a veu ow tynnerghya ha'n wra mosoghes, 50 rag om gwel orth; mes veu ow 51 ow henna a veu ow eyl dhe'n poynt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, 53 e più e più intrava per lo raggio 54 de l’alta luce che da sé è vera.
query.error: **English:** 52 for my sight, becoming pure, 53 entered more and more into the ray 54 of the high light that is true in itself.
query.result: 52 Rag ow golwg, ow tos glan, 53 a veu mos ha mos ow mos dhe'n golwg 54 a'n golwg ughel a yw gwir yn y honan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio 56 che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, 57 e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio.
query.error: **English:** 55 From then on my sight was greater 56 than speech can show, for it yields to such a vision, 57 and memory yields to such an overwhelming experience.
query.result: 55 Wosa henna, ow golwg veu moy 56 ages a wra'n lavarow gwell, rag yth yw ow kolli orth an golwg henna, 57 ha'n golli orth an kov a veu dhe'n poynt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Qual è colüi che sognando vede, 59 che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa 60 rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
query.error: **English:** 58 Like one who sees in a dream, 59 and after the dream the passion imprinted 60 remains, but the rest does not return to the mind,
query.result: 58 Dell yw an neb a wel golwg yn y hun, 59 wosa'n hun, an golwg a wra prentis, 60 mes an remenans na wra dhe'n poynt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa 62 mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla 63 nel core il dolce che nacque da essa.
query.error: **English:** 61 such am I, for almost all of my vision ceases, 62 and still the sweetness born from it 63 distills in my heart.
query.result: 61 henna yw ow, rag bron dhe bron ow golwg a veu dhe'n diwedh, 62 ha bythkweth an downder a veu genys gans an golwg 63 a wra ow kolli yn ow colon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 Così la neve al sol si disigilla; 65 così al vento ne le foglie levi 66 si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla.
query.error: **English:** 64 Thus snow melts in the sun; 65 thus in the wind among the light leaves 66 the prophecy of the Sibyl was lost.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 O somma luce che tanto ti levi 68 da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente 69 ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
query.error: **English:** 67 O supreme light that so far transcendest 68 mortal concepts, restore to my mind 69 a little of what you appeared to be,
query.result: 67 O golwg ughel a yw dhe'n poynt ughel ages 68 ages an konsepyow mortal, dhe'n poynt ow mynysen 69 dyllo dhe'n poynt bythkweth a veu ow golwg orth,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, 71 ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria 72 possa lasciare a la futura gente;
query.error: **English:** 70 and make my tongue so powerful 71 that a single spark of your glory 72 may be left for future generations;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria 74 e per sonare un poco in questi versi, 75 più si conceperà di tua vittoria.
query.error: **English:** 73 for, by returning somewhat to my memory 74 and by sounding a little in these verses, 75 more will be conceived of your victory.
query.result: 73 rag, rag dyllo dhe'n poynt bythkweth dhe'n poynt ow kov 74 ha rag kanna bythkweth yn an versys ma, 75 moy a wra komprehendys a'ga golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi 77 del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, 78 se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi.
query.error: **English:** 76 I believe that, because of the sharpness that I suffered 77 from the living ray, I would have been lost, 78 if my eyes had been turned away from it.
query.result: 76 Kredys, rag an sharpnes a veu ow soffri 77 a'n golwg byw, ow veu kolli, 78 mar veu ow golgas ow trohe dhe'n golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito 80 per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi 81 l’aspetto mio col valore infinito.
query.error: **English:** 79 And I remember that I was more bold 80 because of this to endure, so much so that I brought 81 my gaze into contact with the infinite power.
query.result: 79 Ha kov a wra ow moy bold 80 rag henna rag sosteni, dhe'n poynt ow veu ow gavas 81 ow golwg orth an gallusek infinit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi 83 ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, 84 tanto che la veduta vi consunsi!
query.error: **English:** 82 O abundant grace by which I presumed 83 to fix my gaze on the eternal light, 84 so much so that my sight was consumed by it!
query.result: 82 O gras abundans dreus a veu ow presumy 83 rag fystyn ow golwg orth an golwg byth, 84 dhe'n poynt ow veu ow golwg ow kolli orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, 86 legato con amore in un volume, 87 ciò che per l’universo si squaderna:
query.error: **English:** 85 In its depths I saw that which is contained, 86 bound together with love in a single volume, 87 that which is scattered throughout the universe:
query.result: 85 Yn y downder ow veu henna a yw intern, 86 ow tyi gans karantew yn onan lyver, 87 henna a yw ow skatter dre'n bys:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 sustanze e accidenti e lor costume 89 quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo 90 che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume.
query.error: **English:** 88 substances and accidents and their properties 89 as if fused together, in such a way 90 that what I say is a simple light.
query.result: 88 substansow ha aksidentys ha aga kostomow 89 a veu ow konfli gans onan, yn an fordh ma 90 henna a wra ow leverel yw golwg sempel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 La forma universal di questo nodo 92 credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, 93 dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo.
query.error: **English:** 91 The universal form of this knot 92 I believe that I saw, because more broadly, 93 saying this, I feel that I rejoice.
query.result: 91 Anfurvfurvhembren an keth maen na 92 kredis y’m gweles, rag moy es le, 93 ow leverel henna, y’m teves y’m lowen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo 95 che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa 96 che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo.
query.error: **English:** 94 A single point is greater lethargy to me 95 than twenty-five centuries to the enterprise 96 that made Neptune admire the shadow of Argo.
query.result: 94 Unnik poynt a wra moy le moyha letargo 95 ages deg warn ugens dheg warn vledhen dheg warn blydhen 96 a wrug Nettun omladh skewens Argo.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, 98 mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, 99 e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa.
query.error: **English:** 97 Thus my mind, all suspended, 98 gazed fixedly, motionless and attentive, 99 and ever became more kindled with gazing.
query.result: 97 Vel dhisoma an meyn, oll owthosp, 98 a welas yn fast, heb movyans ha prederus, 99 ha pub prys a wra moyha tanow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 A quella luce cotal si diventa, 101 che volgersi da lei per altro aspetto 102 è impossibil che mai si consenta;
query.error: **English:** 100 To that light one becomes such, 101 that to turn from it for another aspect 102 is impossible that ever it be consented;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 però che ’l ben, ch’è del volere obietto, 104 tutto s’accoglie in lei, e fuor di quella 105 è defettivo ciò ch’è lì perfetto.
query.error: **English:** 103 because the good, which is the object of the will, 104 is all gathered in it, and outside of that 105 is defective that which there is perfect.
query.result: 103 rag an da yw an gwel, an fordh yw an objek, 104 oll a wra junys ynti, ha mes dhyworthi 105 yw difektyv henna syw perffaith ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Omai sarà più corta mia favella, 107 pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante 108 che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella.
query.error: **English:** 106 Henceforth my speech will be shorter, 107 yet to that which I remember, than of a child 108 who still bathes his tongue at the breast.
query.result: 106 Wosa henna vyth leverel moy favella moy gorra, 107 mes dhe’n henna y’m kov, ages bugel 108 sy’n golan bythkweth ha’y tavos dhe’n bronn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Non perché più ch’un semplice sembiante 110 fosse nel vivo lume ch’io mirava, 111 che tal è sempre qual s’era davante;
query.error: **English:** 109 Not because more than a simple semblance 110 was in the living light that I gazed upon, 111 for such it is always as it was before;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 ma per la vista che s’avvalorava 113 in me guardando, una sola parvenza, 114 mutandom’ io, a me si travagliava.
query.error: **English:** 112 but because of the sight that was strengthening 113 in me as I gazed, a single appearance, 114 changing as I did, was travailing towards me.
query.result: 112 mes rag an golwg o’dhaskreskas 113 yn mes ow tosow, unnik parvensa, 114 ow chanjya mes, dhe’n mes o’dhravaelas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Ne la profonda e chiara sussistenza 116 de l’alto lume parvermi tre giri 117 di tre colori e d’una contenenza;
query.error: **English:** 115 In the profound and clear subsistence 116 of the high light appeared to me three circles 117 of three colours and of one content;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 e l’un da l’altro come iri da iri 119 parea reflesso, e ’l terzo parea foco 120 che quinci e quindi igualmente si spiri.
query.error: **English:** 118 and the one from the other like iris from iris 119 seemed reflected, and the third seemed fire 120 that on this side and that equally breathes forth.
query.result: 118 hag an unn dhyworth an aral ages iris dhyworth iris 119 a welas ow reflektya, hag an tresra a welas ages tan 120 a’n keth fordh ha’n keth fordh ow spira yn ughel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco 122 al mio concetto! e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, 123 è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’.
query.error: **English:** 121 Oh how short is the telling and how weak 122 to my conception! and this, to that which I saw, 123 is so much, that it is not enough to say ‘little’.
query.result: 121 Oh kemmys yw an leverel ha ages gwan 122 dhe’n meyn konsept! ha henna, dhe’n henna y’m gweles, 123 yw kemmys, na wra gonis dhe leverel ‘byghan’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, 125 sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta 126 e intendente te ami e arridi!
query.error: **English:** 124 O eternal light that alone abidest in thyself, 125 alone understandest thyself, and by thyself understood 126 and understanding lovest and rejoicest in thyself!
query.result: 124 O golon eternel a syth yn mes owth as, 125 mes owth owth as ow komprehendya, ha dhyworth mes owth as ow komprehendys 126 ha ow komprehendya owth as ow kar ha ow lowen yn mes owth as!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Quella circulazion che sì concetta 128 pareva in te come lume reflesso, 129 da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
query.error: **English:** 127 That circulation which seemed so conceived 128 in thee as light reflected, 129 somewhat circumspect to my eyes,
query.result: 127 An sirkulasyon na a welas kemmys ow konsetya 128 ynti ages golon ow reflektya, 129 dhe’n meyn golwg dhe’n prys owth as ow sirkumspensya,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, 131 mi parve pinta de la nostra effige: 132 per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo.
query.error: **English:** 130 within itself, of its own colour, 131 seemed to me painted with our image: 132 because my sight was wholly set upon it.
query.result: 130 a-berth dhe’n mes, a’y liw hy honan, 131 a welas dhe’n mes ow peyntya gans an effig a’gan honan: 132 rag meyn golwg o’dhaskreskas oll ynti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige 134 per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, 135 pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
query.error: **English:** 133 Like the geometer who applies himself entirely 134 to measuring the circle, and does not find, 135 by thinking, that principle from which he needs to start,
query.result: 133 Kepar dhe jiometra a wra dalleth 134 rag mesura an kelgh, ha na gava, 135 dre vrekka, an pennfent a wra gesys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 tal era io a quella vista nova: 137 veder voleva come si convenne 138 l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova;
query.error: **English:** 136 such was I at that new vision: 137 I wanted to see how the image was appropriate 138 to the circle and how it fits into it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne: 140 se non che la mia mente fu percossa 141 da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne.
query.error: **English:** 139 but my own wings were not capable of this: 140 except that my mind was struck 141 by a flash of light in which its desire was fulfilled.
query.result: 139 mes na wra y egna askel dhe’n ober: 140 marnas ow menes o perthi 141 gans fulgor a wra y dhysi ow tos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa; 143 ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, 144 sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa,
query.error: **English:** 142 At the lofty fantasy here failed the power; 143 but already my desire and will were turning, 144 like a wheel that is moved equally,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle.
query.error: **English:** 145 by the love that moves the sun and the other stars.
query.result: 145 gans an garow a remov an howl hag an steren erel.
